item.value: The close operation can be overridden at this point.

Revalidates the component hierarchy up to the nearest validate root. *

* This method first invalidates the component hierarchy starting from this * component up to the nearest validate root. Afterwards, the component * hierarchy is validated starting from the nearest validate root. *

* This is a convenience method supposed to help application developers * avoid looking for validate roots manually. Basically, it's equivalent to * first calling the {@link #invalidate()} method on this component, and * then calling the {@link #validate()} method on the nearest validate * root.

Appends the specified component to the end of this container. * This is a convenience method for {@link #addImpl}. *

* This method changes layout-related information, and therefore, * invalidates the component hierarchy. If the container has already been * displayed, the hierarchy must be validated thereafter in order to * display the added component.
